      • killAll

      • run

        public void run()
        This function performs the spike routine for a fixed number of fires (nstop). The main characters are: 1. the active neurons: neurons which are over the spike threshold and are going to "shoot" at a certain time. This fire time may be deleted by effect of the arrival of a negative input or anticipated by the arrival of a new excitatory signal. 2. the synapsys queues: synapsys are modeled by a queue for each couple of connected neurons. Each queue holds the signals generated by the source neuron but not still "delivered" at the target neuron.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • splitComplete

        public java.lang.Boolean splitComplete​(java.lang.Integer nodeId)

      • initFromConfigFileAndConnectivityPackage

        public void initFromConfigFileAndConnectivityPackage​(java.lang.String configPath,
                                                     java.lang.String connPkgPath,
                                                     java.lang.Boolean do_fast)
                                              throws BadParametersException
        Read the config files for nodes and connectivity topology, creates a thread for each network node with the corersponding parameters and parametrizes the inter-node synapses
        Parameters:
        configPath - the path of the config package
        connPkgPath - the path of che connectivity package (the folder in which all the topology parameters are stored
        do_fast - if true, fastest algorithms are used (with some aproximations)
        Throws:
        BadParametersException

      • addInterNodeThreadConnection

        public void addInterNodeThreadConnection​(NodeThread nd1,
                                         NodeThread nd2,
                                         java.lang.Double Ne_xn_ratio,
                                         java.lang.Double mu_omega,
                                         java.lang.Double sigma_omega,
                                         java.lang.Double mu_lambda,
                                         java.lang.Double alpha_lambda,
                                         java.lang.Integer inter_node_conn_type)
        Creates a new inter-node connection Each connection is to be intended as a couple of boundle of synapsis between two nodes, one per each direction
        Parameters:
        nd1 - one node of the connection
        nd2 - the other node of the connection
        Ne_xn_ratio - the ratio of excitatory connections
        mu_omega - the mean of postsynaptic weight distribution
        sigma_omega - the std dev of postsynaptic weights distribution
        mu_lambda - the mean of synapsis length distribution
        alpha_lambda - the shape factor of the synapsys length distribution
        inter_node_conn_type - the type of inter node connection
